article.headline: Richmond 92, William &amp, Mary 61
article.story: WILLIAMSBURG, Va. -- Kendall Anthony scored 17 points and Richmond hit 15 3-pointers as the Spiders eased to a 92-61 win over their oldest rival, William & Mary, on Wednesday night. Richmond (5-2) posted its highest point total since a 103-59 win over Virginia Military Institute in November 2009. The Spiders also shot 62.1 percent from the field (36 of 58) for their highest percentage since beating Charleston Southern in 2009. Anthony was 5 of 7 from beyond the arc as the team went 15 of 29 from long range, marking their most successful 3-point performance since a 2004 win over Rhode Island. Cedrick Lindsay added 13 points and Derrick Williams, Josh Dunkier and Conor Smith chipped in 10 apiece. Richmond took its 100th win in the historic series in the 197th meeting between the teams. The Spiders' bench outscored the Tribe 52-20. Tim Rusthoven led William & Mary (1-7) with 15 points.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
